value: aava_1.0_score
description

The two metadata versions represent the same conceptual workflow model with significant structural reorganization and enhanced metadata governance. AAVA 2.0 introduces a more hierarchical structure while preserving core semantic meaning.
Core workflow concept preserved: both versions define a DI AbInitio to PySpark EMR Glue conversion workflow with identical agent purposes and transformation logic.
Major structural reorganization: AAVA 1.0 uses flat 'nodes' array while AAVA 2.0 introduces nested 'workFlowDetail' and 'workflowAgents' structure with enhanced metadata.
Root field 'workflowId' (line 2) renamed to nested 'workFlowDetail.id' (line 3). Semantic meaning preserved but access pattern changed.
Root field 'workflowName' (line 3) renamed to nested 'workFlowDetail.name' (line 4). Value also changed from technical name to human-readable format.
Agent array restructured: 'nodes' (line 4) renamed to 'workflowAgents' (line 6) with enhanced agent metadata including agentId and modelDeploymentName fields.
Agent field 'agentName' (line 6) remains consistent across both versions, preserving agent identity.
Model specification enhanced: 'model' field (line 7) evolved from simple string to 'modelDeploymentName' with updated values (e.g., 'anthropic.claude-4-sonnet' to 'gpt-4.1').
Tools array structure preserved: 'tools' field (line 8) maintains empty array structure in both versions, indicating consistent tool configuration.
Task structure preserved: 'task' object (line 9) maintains identical nested structure with 'description' and 'expectedOutput' fields across both versions.
Agent descriptions remain identical between versions, indicating no content evolution or improvement in agent specifications.
New metadata fields introduced in AAVA 2.0: 'agentId' provides unique identification, 'toolReferences' replaces 'tools' array for better referential integrity.
ID value changed: workflowId changed from 8576 to 8480, potentially indicating different workflow instances or versioning scheme.
AAVA 1.0 JSON is syntactically valid with proper structure, consistent field types, and no broken references.
AAVA 2.0 JSON is syntactically valid with enhanced structure, proper nesting, and consistent field types throughout.
Structural changes may impact dependent systems expecting flat 'nodes' array structure, requiring code updates for field access patterns.
Model deployment name changes could affect system configurations expecting specific model identifiers.
Both versions maintain complete agent task descriptions and expected outputs, ensuring functional equivalence despite structural differences.
Enhanced metadata in AAVA 2.0 provides better governance capabilities with agent IDs and structured tool references.
